de.weltraumschaf.jebnf.ast.visitor
Class TextSyntaxTreeVisitor

java.lang.Object
  de.weltraumschaf.jebnf.ast.visitor.TextSyntaxTreeVisitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Visitor<String>
public class TextSyntaxTreeVisitor
extends Object
implements Visitor<String>

Generates an ASCII formatted tree of the visited AST SyntaxNode node. Example: The file rules_with_literals.ebnf will produce 

 [syntax]
  +--[rule='literal']
      +--[choice]
          +--[sequence]
          |   +--[terminal=''']
          |   +--[identifier='character']
          |   +--[loop]
          |   |   +--[identifier='character']
          |   +--[terminal=''']
          +--[sequence]
              +--[terminal='"']
              +--[identifier='character']
              +--[loop]
              |   +--[identifier='character']
              +--[terminal='"']
For generating the tree lines a two dimensional array is used as "render" matrix. The text is lazy computed by computing the array field column by column and row by row.

Author:
Sven Strittmatter

Constant Field Values

text

private String text
The formatted ASCII text. Lazy computed.

depth

private int depth
Depth of the visited tree. Asked in Visitor.beforeVisit(de.weltraumschaf.jebnf.ast.Visitable) node.

level

private int level
The indention level in the matrix.

matrix

private final List<List<String>> matrix
The matrix. Two dimensional array. Initialized on visiting a SyntaxNode node. So it is important that the syntax node is the root node of the tree. The matrix grows row by row by visiting each child node. A child node represents a row.

formatNode

public static String formatNode(Node node)
Formats nodes two strings. RuleNode, TerminalNode and IdentifierNode nodes will be rendered with their attributes name or value.

createRow

public static List<String> createRow(int colCount)
Returns an list of colCount empty strings as elements.

Parameters:
colCount - Count of columns with empty strings. Throws exception if less than 0.
Returns:
Return string list.

beforeVisit

public void beforeVisit(Visitable visitable)
If as SyntaxNode node comes around the visitor will be initializes. Which means that the depth property is read, the matrix and level properties will be initialized. All other Node types increment the level property.

Specified by:
beforeVisit in interface Visitor<String>
Parameters:
visitable - Visited node.

visit

public void visit(Visitable visitable)
Generates the string contents in the row of the visited node.

Specified by:
visit in interface Visitor<String>
Parameters:
visitable - Visited node.

afterVisit

public void afterVisit(Visitable visitable)
Also "climbs" all rows in the current level and sets a "|" to parent nodes id appropriate. Decrements the level until it reaches 0.

Specified by:
afterVisit in interface Visitor<String>
Parameters:
visitable - visited node.

getResult

public String getResult()
Concatenates the matrix columns and rows and returns the ASCII formatted text. After all visiting is done this method only generates the string once and memorizes the result. Revisiting the tree will cause text regeneration on invoking this method.

Specified by:
getResult in interface Visitor<String>
Returns:
Return formated text.
